alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 9:25PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Norton, eastern Decatur and eastern Red Willow Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 925 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bartley to 7 miles southeast of Oberlin. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jennings around 935 PM CDT. Clayton around 945 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
